title: Affinity Logo - lowercase "a" with a missing tail.
content:
I'm curious about this typeface, is it modified from something else? It seems very familiar and yet I am unable to place it. The sample I have is quite small, hopefully the enlargement is helpful. Thanks very much.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [media.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018210056/http:/typophile.com/files/media_0.jpg) | 16.79 KB |
| [affinity.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018210056/http:/typophile.com/files/affinity_2.gif) | 2.96 KB |
author: Aa

comments.content:
That "y" makes me thing it's a traditional font, heavily "sheared".  
Maybe a Bookman.

hhp
That is exactly what I thought too. You can see certain foundational elements of a traditional font in the f, t, and y.
